spell.name: Spelltrap
entries: You create a spelltrap, marking a complex glyph on yourself, typically manifesting as a small glowing mark on your skin. The first time you are hit by or forced to make a saving throw against a spell of 1st level or lower within the duration, the spelltrap activates and then this spell ends.

When the spelltrap activates, the triggering spell is absorbed and its effects are cancelled. As a reaction to absorbing the triggering spell, you can immediately cast that spell without expending a spell slot.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the maximum level of a spell you can absorb increases by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.
